subject: Noise complaint from upstairs neighbor - Update
body: Hi, I wanted to follow up on my noise complaint. The situation has improved since our last conversation, but there was another incident last night around 11:30 PM. The music was quite loud again. Has the building management spoken with the tenant in unit 401? Please let me know the next steps. Thanks, John Smith - Unit 301
triage_recommendation: Link to existing noise complaint task (Task-001). Customer is requesting update on previously reported issue. Priority: Medium - ongoing issue requiring follow-up.

subject: Follow-up on noise complaint
notes: Called John Smith to acknowledge his latest email and provide update. Explained that we have contacted the tenant in 401 and issued a formal notice. Tenant has been cooperative and agreed to keep noise levels down after 10 PM. Scheduled a follow-up check in one week.

body: Noise started again at 10:30pm. Music is very loud. Please help.

subject: Parking violation - Still ongoing
body:
Dear Support Team,

I reported a parking violation in my assigned spot P-23 three days ago, but the unknown vehicle is still there. This is really frustrating as I pay for this parking spot and now have to park on the street. Can someone please take immediate action? The license plate is ABC123. I've attached photos as well.

Best regards,
Sarah Jones - Unit 205

subject: Re: Parking violation - Action being taken
body:
Dear Sarah,

Thank you for your patience regarding the parking violation in spot P-23. We have:

1. Posted a final violation notice on the vehicle
2. Contacted the towing company - they will remove the vehicle tomorrow morning if not moved
3. Sent a building-wide reminder about visitor parking policies
4. Added additional security patrols for the parking area

We apologize for the inconvenience and will ensure this doesn't happen again.

Best regards,
Steward Property Management

notes: Sarah called to confirm that the unauthorized vehicle has been removed and thanked us for the quick resolution. She expressed satisfaction with the communication and follow-through.

subject: Elevator maintenance inquiry
body: I noticed the elevator has been making unusual sounds for the past few days. Sometimes it jerks when stopping at floors. Is this being looked into? Should we be concerned about safety?

subject: Elevator safety update
notes: Called Mike to inform him that we have scheduled an emergency elevator inspection for today. Explained that certified technicians will assess the elevator and we will post notices if any safety concerns are found. Assured him that resident safety is our top priority.

subject: Emergency water leak
notes: Emergency call from Lisa Chen in unit 302. Reports significant water leak coming through her ceiling from the unit above. Water is dripping into her living room and causing damage. Requested immediate assistance.

body: Lisa, emergency plumber is on the way - ETA 30 minutes. Please turn off water at the main if possible. We're also contacting the upstairs unit. Will keep you updated.

subject: Water leak repair update and next steps
body:
Dear Lisa,

Following today's emergency water leak, here's an update:

‚úÖ COMPLETED:
- Emergency plumber attended and stopped the leak
- Source identified: faulty washing machine connection in unit 402
- Temporary repairs completed

üìã NEXT STEPS:
- Insurance assessor will inspect damage tomorrow (Nov 12) at 10 AM
- Professional water damage restoration team scheduled for Nov 13
- Permanent plumbing repairs scheduled for Nov 14

Please document any damaged items for insurance purposes. We will cover temporary accommodation if needed.

Best regards,
Steward Property Management

subject: HVAC system performance issues
body:
Hello,

I've noticed that the common area HVAC system doesn't seem to be working efficiently. The lobby and hallways are quite warm, and I can hear the system running constantly. This might be wasting energy and increasing our strata fees. Could someone please investigate?

Thanks,
Robert Davis - Unit 150

subject: HVAC Investigation Scheduled
body:
Dear Robert,

Thank you for reporting the HVAC efficiency concerns. We take energy management seriously as it affects everyone's costs.

We have scheduled:
- HVAC technician inspection: November 12, 2024
- Air filter replacement and system cleaning
- Efficiency assessment and recommendations

We'll provide a full report and any recommended improvements after the inspection.

Regards,
Building Maintenance Team

subject: Pool maintenance concerns
notes: Amanda Rodriguez called to report that the pool water appears cloudy and there's an unusual chemical smell. She's concerned about water quality and safety for residents. Requested immediate testing and maintenance.

subject: Pool maintenance - Immediate action taken
body:
Dear Amanda,

Thank you for reporting the pool water quality concerns. We've taken immediate action:

üö´ POOL TEMPORARILY CLOSED for safety
‚öóÔ∏è Water testing conducted - results pending
üîß Pool maintenance company dispatched
üìã Full chemical balance review in progress

We expect to have the pool reopened within 24-48 hours once water quality is confirmed safe. We'll post updates on the community notice board.

Thank you for looking out for everyone's safety.

Best regards,
Steward Property Management

subject: Question about AGM voting procedures
body:
Hi there,

I have a question about the upcoming Annual General Meeting. Can I submit my vote by proxy if I'm unable to attend in person? Also, what's the deadline for proxy submissions?

Thanks,
John Smith - Unit 301

subject: Gym equipment malfunction
notes: Sarah Jones called to report that the treadmill in the gym is making strange noises and the belt seems to be slipping. She's concerned about safety and wants it looked at.

body: The hallway light on floor 3 has been out for a week now. Can someone please replace it? It's quite dark at night.

subject: Pet policy clarification needed
body:
Hello,

I'm considering adopting a dog and wanted to clarify the building's pet policy. Are there any breed or size restrictions? Do I need to register my pet with the strata? Is there a pet deposit required?

I want to make sure I follow all the rules before proceeding.

Thanks,
Robert Davis - Unit 150
triage_recommendation: Create new task for pet policy inquiry. Category: General Inquiry. Priority: Low - routine policy question, no urgency. Recommend sending standard pet policy documentation and registration form.

subject: Recycling bin overflow in basement
body: The recycling bins in the basement are completely full and overflowing. Cardboard boxes are stacked next to the bins. Can we schedule an extra pickup or provide additional bins? This has been an ongoing issue.
triage_recommendation: Create new task for waste management issue. Category: Maintenance. Priority: Medium - recurring issue affecting common areas. Action required: Contact waste management provider for extra pickup and assess if additional bins are needed. Customer flagged this as ongoing problem.

subject: Request for financial statements
body:
Dear Strata Management,

I'm in the process of refinancing my unit and my bank requires the latest strata financial statements and meeting minutes from the past year. Could you please provide these documents at your earliest convenience?

Thank you,
Lisa Chen - Unit 302
